{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Personal Assistant (P.A)",
  "description": "Rentachef NG is a leading catering, hospitality consulting, and chef rental agency in Nigeria. Company provides private chef service to customers across Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant (P.A)
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki / Ikate, Lagos&nbsp;(Proximity is essential)
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	At Rentachef NG, we don&#39;t just provide food; we curate culinary experiences.
	From intimate private dinners to high-profile catering, we are redefining what it means to dine well in Lagos.
	To keep our engine running smoothly, our CEO needs a sharp, high-energy, and deeply organized Personal Assistant to act as their right hand and brand ambassador.


What You&rsquo;ll be Doing
Your mission is to clear the path so the CEO can focus on growing the brand
Your day-to-day will involve:


	Orchestrating the Day: You&rsquo;ll manage the CEO&rsquo;s calendar like a pro&mdash;scheduling meetings, client consultations, and visits, ensuring the day flows logically and reminders are never missed.
	The Voice of the Brand: You&rsquo;ll be the first point of contact for our clients, vendors, and partners. Whether you&rsquo;re answering calls or drafting polished emails, you&rsquo;ll handle every interaction with grace and professionalism.
	Logistics &amp; Travel: Whether it&rsquo;s booking a flight or navigating through Lagos traffic for a high-priority meeting, you make sure the CEO gets there on time and stress-free. You are responsible for ensuring the CEO isn&#39;t just &quot;on the way,&quot; but arrives calm, prepared, and ahead of schedule, despite the unpredictability of traffic.
	Business Backbone: You&rsquo;ll handle the &quot;behind-the-scenes&quot; essentials&mdash;preparing presentation decks for corporate pitches, taking meeting notes, and conducting research.
	The Personal Touch: No two days are the same. You might find yourself assisting with personal shopping or managing private appointments to ensure the CEO&rsquo;s personal and professional lives stay in balance.


Who You Are?


	A Lekki/Ikate Resident: You live close to the action. We value your time, and we know that living near Ikate or Lekki means you&rsquo;ll spend less time in traffic and more time making an impact.
	Well-Educated: You hold a degree in Business Administration, Mass Communication, Marketing, English, Economics, or Finance. You know how to apply your academic background to real-world business challenges.
	Sharp &amp; Detailed: You have a &quot;detective&rsquo;s eye&quot; for detail. Whether it&rsquo;s a contract or a dinner menu, you spot the errors others miss.
	A Natural Problem-Solver: When a vendor is late or a schedule shifts last minute, you don&rsquo;t panic. You think on your feet and find a workaround.
	Discreet &amp; Trustworthy: You&rsquo;ll be handling sensitive business and personal information. To you, confidentiality isn&rsquo;t just a rule&mdash;it&rsquo;s a habit.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with at least 2 years experience.


Why Rentachef NG?


	You&rsquo;ll be joining a vibrant, creative team that sits at the intersection of customer satisfaction and hospitality.
	This isn&#39;t a boring desk job; it&rsquo;s a front-row seat to building one of the most exciting culinary brands in Nigeria.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;rentachefrecruit@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Personal Assistant (P.A) Job at Rentachef NG




        
    

        
        Rentachef NG is a leading catering, hospitality consulting, and chef rental agency in Nigeria. Company provides private chef service to customers across Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant (P.A)
Job Location: Lekki / Ikate, Lagos (Proximity is essential)
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	At Rentachef NG, we don't just provide food; we curate culinary experiences.
	From intimate private dinners to high-profile catering, we are redefining what it means to dine well in Lagos.
	To keep our engine running smoothly, our CEO needs a sharp, high-energy, and deeply organized Personal Assistant to act as their right hand and brand ambassador.


What You’ll be Doing
Your mission is to clear the path so the CEO can focus on growing the brand
Your day-to-day will involve:


	Orchestrating the Day: You’ll manage the CEO’s calendar like a pro—scheduling meetings, client consultations, and visits, ensuring the day flows logically and reminders are never missed.
	The Voice of the Brand: You’ll be the first point of contact for our clients, vendors, and partners. Whether you’re answering calls or drafting polished emails, you’ll handle every interaction with grace and professionalism.
	Logistics & Travel: Whether it’s booking a flight or navigating through Lagos traffic for a high-priority meeting, you make sure the CEO gets there on time and stress-free. You are responsible for ensuring the CEO isn't just "on the way," but arrives calm, prepared, and ahead of schedule, despite the unpredictability of traffic.
	Business Backbone: You’ll handle the "behind-the-scenes" essentials—preparing presentation decks for corporate pitches, taking meeting notes, and conducting research.
	The Personal Touch: No two days are the same. You might find yourself assisting with personal shopping or managing private appointments to ensure the CEO’s personal and professional lives stay in balance.


Who You Are?


	A Lekki/Ikate Resident: You live close to the action. We value your time, and we know that living near Ikate or Lekki means you’ll spend less time in traffic and more time making an impact.
	Well-Educated: You hold a degree in Business Administration, Mass Communication, Marketing, English, Economics, or Finance. You know how to apply your academic background to real-world business challenges.
	Sharp & Detailed: You have a "detective’s eye" for detail. Whether it’s a contract or a dinner menu, you spot the errors others miss.
	A Natural Problem-Solver: When a vendor is late or a schedule shifts last minute, you don’t panic. You think on your feet and find a workaround.
	Discreet & Trustworthy: You’ll be handling sensitive business and personal information. To you, confidentiality isn’t just a rule—it’s a habit.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with at least 2 years experience.


Why Rentachef NG?


	You’ll be joining a vibrant, creative team that sits at the intersection of customer satisfaction and hospitality.
	This isn't a boring desk job; it’s a front-row seat to building one of the most exciting culinary brands in Nigeria.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: rentachefrecruit@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Fibre Planner",
  "description": "WIOCC is the leading player in the deployment of carrier-scale, future-proofed network infrastructure into Africa. We have the flexibility and scale to meet the ever-growing demand for reliable, high-speed capacity throughout Africa, driven by end consumers, enterprise users and the ecosystem that supports them. Our policy of continual investment in our network to create Africa&rsquo;s first, truly hyperscale network infrastructure means ongoing investment for growth, ensuring our readiness to meet the future data volume demands of end users throughout Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fibre Planner

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Reporting Line:&nbsp;Network Architect

Job Objective


	To plan, design and optimise access, metro and core fibre infrastructure by maximising the use of existing assets and defining new build requirements where necessary.
	The role is recognised as a Level 3 technical authority for fibre network planning, responsible for producing High-Level Designs (HLDs) and Low-Level Designs (LLDs) and providing expert input into network architecture, route strategy and design governance.
	The&nbsp;Fibre&nbsp;Planner ensures that all&nbsp;fibre&nbsp;designs are technically sound, commercially efficient, operationally sustainable, and accurately reflected in enterprise systems and network records.&nbsp;


Key Duties and Responsibilities
Network Planning, Architecture and Design:


	Plan and design new access, metro, and core&nbsp;fibre&nbsp;routes, including ducts, spurs,&nbsp;PoP&nbsp;entries and&nbsp;FTTx&nbsp;infrastructure
	Develop and&nbsp;maintain&nbsp;High-Level Designs (HLDs) for new builds, expansions and strategic capacity initiatives
	Produce detailed, build-ready Low-Level Designs (LLDs) including route maps, splice plans,&nbsp;fibre&nbsp;allocations,&nbsp;BoQs and implementation specifications
	Translate business, commercial and technical requirements into scalable network designs
	Optimise&nbsp;route planning to&nbsp;maximise&nbsp;reuse&nbsp;of existing infrastructure and&nbsp;minimise&nbsp;deployment costs
	Define technical standards for&nbsp;fibre&nbsp;types, ducting, jointing methods, protection, resilience and redundancy
	Ensure designs consider long-term scalability, resilience, operational maintainability and lifecycle management


Stakeholder Engagement and Delivery Support:


	Collaborate with Project Managers to ensure designs are understood and executable
	Liaise with contractors and suppliers to ensure&nbsp;accurate&nbsp;implementation of designs
	Provide&nbsp;technical guidance throughout the delivery lifecycle
	Support cross-functional collaboration across Engineering, Operations, Field Services, Sales and Capacity Planning


Wayleaves, Rights of Way and Feasibility:


	Support identification and planning of wayleaves and rights of way
	Provide technical input into feasibility studies
	Identify&nbsp;risks related to route availability, access and regulatory constraints


Network Data Integrity and Asset Management:


	Ensure all infrastructure is accurately recorded in OSS/BSS systems (e.g.&nbsp;NetSuite)
	Contribute to&nbsp;fibre&nbsp;record management, auditing and documentation
	Support periodic audits of network assets and records


Technical Assurance and Risk Management:


	Perform quality assurance on&nbsp;designs&nbsp;and deployed infrastructure
	Review and assure HLDs and LLDs for compliance with standards
	Interpret OTDR/OLTS results and&nbsp;validate&nbsp;performance
	Identify&nbsp;and mitigate technical risks


Project and Business Support:


	Contribute to&nbsp;strategic planning initiatives
	Support commercial opportunities with technical feasibility input
	Drive continuous improvement in tools, templates and standards


Minimum Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering, Network Engineering, or related field OR equivalent experience


Experience and Technical Skills:


	Minimum of 3 years in telecommunications with at least 2 years in fibre planning/design
	Experience in real-world fibre network deployments
	Strong understanding of ducts, fibre types, splicing, protection methods
	Knowledge of DWDM (10G/40G/100G), OTN and transmission platforms (Alcatel, ADVA, Ciena, Infinera, Tejas)
	Experience with OTDR, OLTS, optical link budgets
	Ability to interpret fibre test results
	Experience with Google Earth, QGIS, OSS/BSS platforms
	Strong analytical, communication and problem-solving skills


Attributes:


	Client focused, relationship builder
	Integrity, honest with high ethical standards
	Boundless, passionate and flexible
	Personal excellence, accuracy and attention to detail
	Collaborative, achieve results through teamwork and partnerships
	Passionate, adaptable and proactive
	Strong attention to detail
",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-04",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-05",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "WIOCC Nigeria Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "value": "194054"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Fibre Planner Job at WIOCC Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        WIOCC is the leading player in the deployment of carrier-scale, future-proofed network infrastructure into Africa. We have the flexibility and scale to meet the ever-growing demand for reliable, high-speed capacity throughout Africa, driven by end consumers, enterprise users and the ecosystem that supports them. Our policy of continual investment in our network to create Africa’s first, truly hyperscale network infrastructure means ongoing investment for growth, ensuring our readiness to meet the future data volume demands of end users throughout Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fibre Planner

Job Location: Lagos
Reporting Line: Network Architect
     

            
    



Job Objective


	To plan, design and optimise access, metro and core fibre infrastructure by maximising the use of existing assets and defining new build requirements where necessary.
	The role is recognised as a Level 3 technical authority for fibre network planning, responsible for producing High-Level Designs (HLDs) and Low-Level Designs (LLDs) and providing expert input into network architecture, route strategy and design governance.
	The Fibre Planner ensures that all fibre designs are technically sound, commercially efficient, operationally sustainable, and accurately reflected in enterprise systems and network records. 


Key Duties and Responsibilities
Network Planning, Architecture and Design:


	Plan and design new access, metro, and core fibre routes, including ducts, spurs, PoP entries and FTTx infrastructure
	Develop and maintain High-Level Designs (HLDs) for new builds, expansions and strategic capacity initiatives
	Produce detailed, build-ready Low-Level Designs (LLDs) including route maps, splice plans, fibre allocations, BoQs and implementation specifications
	Translate business, commercial and technical requirements into scalable network designs
	Optimise route planning to maximise reuse of existing infrastructure and minimise deployment costs
	Define technical standards for fibre types, ducting, jointing methods, protection, resilience and redundancy
	Ensure designs consider long-term scalability, resilience, operational maintainability and lifecycle management


Stakeholder Engagement and Delivery Support:


	Collaborate with Project Managers to ensure designs are understood and executable
	Liaise with contractors and suppliers to ensure accurate implementation of designs
	Provide technical guidance throughout the delivery lifecycle
	Support cross-functional collaboration across Engineering, Operations, Field Services, Sales and Capacity Planning


Wayleaves, Rights of Way and Feasibility:


	Support identification and planning of wayleaves and rights of way
	Provide technical input into feasibility studies
	Identify risks related to route availability, access and regulatory constraints


Network Data Integrity and Asset Management:


	Ensure all infrastructure is accurately recorded in OSS/BSS systems (e.g. NetSuite)
	Contribute to fibre record management, auditing and documentation
	Support periodic audits of network assets and records


Technical Assurance and Risk Management:


	Perform quality assurance on designs and deployed infrastructure
	Review and assure HLDs and LLDs for compliance with standards
	Interpret OTDR/OLTS results and validate performance
	Identify and mitigate technical risks


Project and Business Support:


	Contribute to strategic planning initiatives
	Support commercial opportunities with technical feasibility input
	Drive continuous improvement in tools, templates and standards


Minimum Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering, Network Engineering, or related field OR equivalent experience


Experience and Technical Skills:


	Minimum of 3 years in telecommunications with at least 2 years in fibre planning/design
	Experience in real-world fibre network deployments
	Strong understanding of ducts, fibre types, splicing, protection methods
	Knowledge of DWDM (10G/40G/100G), OTN and transmission platforms (Alcatel, ADVA, Ciena, Infinera, Tejas)
	Experience with OTDR, OLTS, optical link budgets
	Ability to interpret fibre test results
	Experience with Google Earth, QGIS, OSS/BSS platforms
	Strong analytical, communication and problem-solving skills


Attributes:


	Client focused, relationship builder
	Integrity, honest with high ethical standards
	Boundless, passionate and flexible
	Personal excellence, accuracy and attention to detail
	Collaborative, achieve results through teamwork and partnerships
	Passionate, adaptable and proactive
	Strong attention to detail
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, Regulatory Compliance",
  "description": "Interswitch is an Africa-focused integrated digital payments and commerce company that facilitates the electronic circulation of money as well as the exchange of value between individuals and organisations on a timely and consistent basis. We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Regulatory Compliance

Job Location: Lagos

About the Job


	To manage a team of Compliance Officers, that conducts internal audits to ensure compliance with outside regulatory requirements and internal policies with respect to the telecommunication industry.
	To provide Compliance advice and implement the Interswitch&rsquo;s Compliance standards in line with regulatory requirements, applicable codes of conduct and best practices with respect to the telecommunication industry.
	To maintain Interswitch&rsquo;s legal, regulatory, and ethical integrity.
	To contribute to the Compliance strategy design and monitor its execution in line with Interswitch&rsquo;s overall strategic directions.


Responsibilities
Regulatory and Compliance Management:


	Help design and implement a Compliance program, liaising with the regulator to ensure the program adheres to regulatory and compliance standards with respect to the telecommunication industry.
	Lead the activities of the NCC Compliance team and guide them to execute.
	Compliance strategy and Compliance plan, highlight shortcomings and suggest improvements in current Compliance processes, systems, and procedures.
	Review Interswitch&rsquo;s documented Compliance policies, procedures, and codes of conduct, monitor compliance against Compliance framework with respect to the telecommunication industry.
	Ensure Interswitch is not exposed to undue risks by using risk management systems to achieve specific goals within designated areas of the business.
	Contribute to the design of Compliance strategy in line with Interswitch&rsquo;s overall strategic directions.


Performance Management:


	Develop and propose own performance objectives; take appropriate actions to ensure achievement of agreed objectives, using the Interswitch performance management systems to improve personal performance.
	Manage and report on Compliance team performance; set appropriate performance objectives for direct reports and hold them accountable for achieving these, taking appropriate corrective action where necessary to ensure the achievement of team / personal objectives.


Capacity Building:


	Use the Interswitch formal development framework to identify the Compliance team&#39;s individual development needs.
	Act as their mentor and coach whilst fostering an environment of mutual respect and trust.
	Plan and implement actions to build their capabilities.
	Develop training materials and conduct e-learning training on Compliance related activities to aid the understanding, adoption and seamless operation of AML / CFT, KYC, Whistleblowing, and other Compliance programs.


Operational Compliance:


	Maintain and renew a deep knowledge and understanding of the Interswitch policies and procedures and of relevant regulatory codes and codes of conduct, and ensure own work adheres to required standards.
	Identify within Interswitch, patterns of non-compliance with Compliance policies and procedures, and with relevant regulatory codes of conduct, taking appropriate actions to escalate and resolving these issues.


Client and Customer Management:


	Support internal customers and help the Compliance Manager manage internal client relationships.
	Resolve complex compliance queries from internal or external customers or suppliers by providing information on policies and procedures, and provide relevant suggestions to Compliance Manager
	Build and maintain long-term relationships with contractors, clients, consultants, and compliance specialists in the Compliance ecosystem.


Insights and Reporting:


	Prepare and coordinate the completion of various data and analytics reports.
	Submit bi-weekly reports to the Chief Compliance Officer to share compliance issues and decisions; integrate suggestions and feedback in daily operations.


Requirements
General Education:


	University / Post Graduate Degree in Accountancy, Banking, Business or Law, or relevant professional qualification in financial services or audit
	Possessing any of the following certifications is mandatory
	Association of Certified AntiMoney Laundering Specialists (ACAMS) or its Equivalent
	Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)


General Experience:


	At least 10 years of relevant experience in Compliance roles within the Telecommunications industry
	This will enable the job holder to deal with the majority of situations and to advise others
	Experience should include: Solid working knowledge of telecommunications regulations with a strong understanding of the local regulatory regime
	Advised senior management on corporate and / or regulatory policies and procedures
	Prior experience applying for licenses would be highly advantageous


Managerial Experience:


	At least 5 years of experience of supervising and directing people and other resources to achieve specific end results within limited timeframe
",
  "datePosted": "2026-02-04",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-05",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Interswitch"
    
  },

      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }

}



Head, Regulatory Compliance Job at Interswitch




        
    

        
        Interswitch is an Africa-focused integrated digital payments and commerce company that facilitates the electronic circulation of money as well as the exchange of value between individuals and organisations on a timely and consistent basis. We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Head, Regulatory Compliance

Job Location: Lagos

About the Job


	To manage a team of Compliance Officers, that conducts internal audits to ensure compliance with outside regulatory requirements and internal policies with respect to the telecommunication industry.
	To provide Compliance advice and implement the Interswitch’s Compliance standards in line with regulatory requirements, applicable codes of conduct and best practices with respect to the telecommunication industry.
	To maintain Interswitch’s legal, regulatory, and ethical integrity.
	To contribute to the Compliance strategy design and monitor its execution in line with Interswitch’s overall strategic directions.


Responsibilities
Regulatory and Compliance Management:


	Help design and implement a Compliance program, liaising with the regulator to ensure the program adheres to regulatory and compliance standards with respect to the telecommunication industry.
	Lead the activities of the NCC Compliance team and guide them to execute.
	Compliance strategy and Compliance plan, highlight shortcomings and suggest improvements in current Compliance processes, systems, and procedures.
	Review Interswitch’s documented Compliance policies, procedures, and codes of conduct, monitor compliance against Compliance framework with respect to the telecommunication industry.
	Ensure Interswitch is not exposed to undue risks by using risk management systems to achieve specific goals within designated areas of the business.
	Contribute to the design of Compliance strategy in line with Interswitch’s overall strategic directions.


Performance Management:


	Develop and propose own performance objectives; take appropriate actions to ensure achievement of agreed objectives, using the Interswitch performance management systems to improve personal performance.
	Manage and report on Compliance team performance; set appropriate performance objectives for direct reports and hold them accountable for achieving these, taking appropriate corrective action where necessary to ensure the achievement of team / personal objectives.


Capacity Building:


	Use the Interswitch formal development framework to identify the Compliance team's individual development needs.
	Act as their mentor and coach whilst fostering an environment of mutual respect and trust.
	Plan and implement actions to build their capabilities.
	Develop training materials and conduct e-learning training on Compliance related activities to aid the understanding, adoption and seamless operation of AML / CFT, KYC, Whistleblowing, and other Compliance programs.


Operational Compliance:


	Maintain and renew a deep knowledge and understanding of the Interswitch policies and procedures and of relevant regulatory codes and codes of conduct, and ensure own work adheres to required standards.
	Identify within Interswitch, patterns of non-compliance with Compliance policies and procedures, and with relevant regulatory codes of conduct, taking appropriate actions to escalate and resolving these issues.


Client and Customer Management:


	Support internal customers and help the Compliance Manager manage internal client relationships.
	Resolve complex compliance queries from internal or external customers or suppliers by providing information on policies and procedures, and provide relevant suggestions to Compliance Manager
	Build and maintain long-term relationships with contractors, clients, consultants, and compliance specialists in the Compliance ecosystem.


Insights and Reporting:


	Prepare and coordinate the completion of various data and analytics reports.
	Submit bi-weekly reports to the Chief Compliance Officer to share compliance issues and decisions; integrate suggestions and feedback in daily operations.


Requirements
General Education:


	University / Post Graduate Degree in Accountancy, Banking, Business or Law, or relevant professional qualification in financial services or audit
	Possessing any of the following certifications is mandatory
	Association of Certified AntiMoney Laundering Specialists (ACAMS) or its Equivalent
	Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)


General Experience:


	At least 10 years of relevant experience in Compliance roles within the Telecommunications industry
	This will enable the job holder to deal with the majority of situations and to advise others
	Experience should include: Solid working knowledge of telecommunications regulations with a strong understanding of the local regulatory regime
	Advised senior management on corporate and / or regulatory policies and procedures
	Prior experience applying for licenses would be highly advantageous


Managerial Experience:


	At least 5 years of experience of supervising and directing people and other resources to achieve specific end results within limited timeframe
    

    

        Click here to Apply

                        Risk and Quality Associate Job at PricewaterhouseCoopers

Java Engineer Job at Conclase Consulting




        
    

        
        At Conclase Consulting, we provide top notch IT solutions and support services to help you transform your business into an Intelligent Enterprise, redefine the customer experience, deliver a step change in productivity, and inspire total workforce engagement to achieve game-changing outcomes.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Java Engineer
Job Location: Ikeja & Lekki - Lagos
Work Model: Onsite 

Requirements
     

            
    




	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 5+ years of experience; Banking or Fintech Experience is a must.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@conclaseint.com or o.akindiya@conclaseint.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
